bibl.title: Despatch from Alexander Clark to William F. Wharton, May 11, 1891
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, Liberia May 11th 1891
Mr Alexander Clark to the Department of State
Accounts and Returns from the Consular Agent at Elmina
Consulate General of the United States Monrovia Liberia May 11th 1891
Hon. William F. Wharton Assistant Secretary of State Washington D. C.
Sir: I have the honor respectfully to transmit herewith the Accounts and returns of the Consular Agent at Elmina, for the quarter ended March 31st, 1891, as per subjoined list of enclosures.
I have the honor to be, Sir, Your obedient Servant
Alexander Clark U.S. M. R. & Consul Gen
1. Summary of Business 2. Arrivals and Departures of American vessels 3. Digest of Invoice Book. 4. Detailed Report of Official service rendered American vessels and seamen
